abstract: Timothy J. Mayopoulos, Bank of America’s former general counsel, has refused to reveal certain specifics of disclosure decisions he weighed in on at the company.
snippet: Timothy J. Mayopoulos, Bank of America’s former general counsel, has refused to reveal certain specifics of disclosure decisions he weighed in on at the company.
lead_paragraph: Four days after Bank of America shareholders voted to approve a merger with Merrill Lynch, Timothy J. Mayopoulos, the bank’s general counsel, was summoned to an executive suite.

headline.main: Bank Firing of Counsel Is Examined
headline.print_headline: Bank Firing Of Counsel Is Examined

abstract: NYSE Euronext has agreed to sell stakes in the options business it inherited when it bought the American Stock Exchange to seven brokerages.
snippet: NYSE Euronext has agreed to sell stakes in the options business it inherited when it bought the American Stock Exchange to seven brokerages.
lead_paragraph: NYSE Euronext has agreed to sell stakes in the options business it inherited when it bought the American Stock Exchange to seven brokerages, including Bank of America, Barclays and Goldman Sachs, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: NYSE Euronext to Sell Stakes in Amex Options Unit

abstract: The timing of the dismissal Bank of America’s general counsel is coming under the spotlight as Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo of New York and other investigators examine why BofA did not tell shareholders about bonuses and losses at Merrill Lynch before buying the investment bank.
snippet: The timing of the dismissal Bank of America’s general counsel is coming under the spotlight as Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo of New York and other investigators examine why BofA did not tell shareholders about bonuses and losses at Merrill Lync...
lead_paragraph: Four days after Bank of America shareholders voted to approve a merger with Merrill Lynch, Timothy J. Mayopoulos, the bank’s general counsel, was summoned to an executive suite.

headline.main: Firing of Bank of America Counsel Is Examined

abstract: Bank of America dug in its heels in response to two investigations of its shotgun merger with Merrill Lynch at the height of the financial crisis last year.
snippet: Bank of America dug in its heels in response to two investigations of its shotgun merger with Merrill Lynch at the height of the financial crisis last year.
lead_paragraph: From Louise Story, a DealBook colleague:

abstract: Not all of the names that surfaced after the wreck of the financial system deserve reproach. Some should get a word of thanks.
snippet: Not all of the names that surfaced after the wreck of the financial system deserve reproach. Some should get a word of thanks.
lead_paragraph: Investors should thank their lucky stars for people like Jed Rakoff. He’s the federal judge taking Bank of America and the Securities and Exchange Commission to task for the agreement they reached to settle allegations that Bank of America kept its shareholders in the dark about bonus payments for Merrill Lynch employees.

headline.main: Some Good Names in a Year Gone Bad
headline.print_headline: Some Good Names in a Year Gone Bad
